Articles.Content:
So, this thread is all about exoplanets, their discoveries, or if they rain glass... 

Credits: NASA Ames/SETI Institute/JPL-Caltech (Kepler-186f)

So, on the blue HD 189733b it rains molten glass and has wind speeds of over 7,000 kmph (4350 mph). Making it so it doesn't just rain molten glass, but rains sideways; and has a atmospheric temperature of over 1,000 degrees C (1,830 degrees F)

Edited August 3, 2017 by Xemina

Im not really focused towards Exoplanets too much, since my brain explodes and my eyes shoot out and reach escape velocity whenever i think about how scientist can calculate the characteristics of a planet just by looking at a few pixels and blobs.
